title: Fact Check: Old video of Leopard prowling in Jalandhar shared with fake claim | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A video post of a leopard prowling in a crowded area is doing the rounds on social media. It is being claimed that it was spotted in Jalandhar. The post also implies that the video is linked to the ongoing lockdown due to COVID-19.

The caption of the post read: “Poor terrified #Leopard which strayed into a town in #jallandhar, Punjab,#India. #SocialDistancing forgotten in this chaos #COVID19 #coronavirus”

NewsMobile fact-checked the video and found that the claim is false.

We ran a search using keywords such as ‘leopard’, ‘Jalandhar’ etc along with a screen grab of the video and found various reports from 2019. The reports can be read here, here and here.

According to the reports, the leopard strayed into Lama Pind area of Jalandhar from the hilly areas of Himachal Pradesh on January 31, 2019, and injured four people.

We also found the video on YouTube on the official channel of The Times of India, dated January 31, 2019.

Hence, the above information proves that the video in question is old and has no relation with the COVID-19 lockdown.

If you want to fact-check any story, WhatsApp it now on +91 88268 00707
